etymologies: late Middle English: from medieval Latin quotare, from quot ‘how many’, or from medieval Latin quota (see quota). The original sense was ‘mark a book with numbers, or with marginal references’, later ‘give a reference by page or chapter’, hence ‘cite a text or person’ (late 16th century)

definitions: repeat or copy out (a group of words from a text or speech), typically with an indication that one is not the original author or speaker

examples.text: he quoted a passage from the Psalms
“The stream mysterious glides beneath,” Melinda quoted
when we told her this she said, and I quote, “Phooey!”

definitions: repeat a passage from (a work or author) or statement by (someone)

examples.text: the prime minister was quoted as saying that he would resist all attempts to “sabotage” his government
he quoted Shakespeare, Goethe, and other poets

definitions: mention or refer to (someone or something) to provide evidence or authority for a statement, argument, or opinion

examples.text: they won't be here at all in three years time— you can quote me on that

shortDefinitions: mention or refer to person or thing to provide evidence or authority

definitions: put forward or describe someone or something as being

examples.text: heavy teaching loads are often quoted as a bad influence on research

shortDefinitions: put forward or describe person or thing as being

definitions: give someone (the estimated price of a job or service)

examples.text: the agent quoted him a fare of $180

definitions: give (a company) a quotation or listing on a stock exchange

examples.text: an organization that is quoted on the Stock Exchange

shortDefinitions: give company quotation or listing on stock exchange

definitions: a quotation from a text or speech

examples.text: use double quotes around precise phrases you wish to search for

definitions: a quotation giving the estimated cost for a particular job or service
shortDefinitions: quotation giving estimated cost for particular job or service

definitions: a price offered by a broker for the sale or purchase of a stock or other security

examples.text: quotes for North Sea Brent were rising

shortDefinitions: price offered by market-maker for sale or purchase of stock

definitions: a quotation or listing of a company on a stock exchange.
shortDefinitions: quotation or listing of company on stock exchange
